summary: the endosymbiotic bacterium, Wolbachia, suppresses replication of several pathogenic viruses in A. aegypti and enhances AeAV replication. these findings expand the virome in A. aegypti and provide insight into the complexity of Wolbachia-virus interactions. new tab Cytoplasmic retention of vhs and gD mRNA in cells expressing both transcripts. hypovirulence occurs when viral infections impair fungal growth, reproduction, or virulence. findings may advance approaches using mycoviruses or viral proteins. HCoV OC43 invades the CNS (blue) mainly through the olfactory bulb (2). HCoV OC43 invades the CNS (blue).
